rev.comment: PLEASE avoid words like "criticism" or "controversy", just tell the facts and let users decide
rev.diff:
Line 3: Line 3:
'''Lycos Europe''' is a [[pan-European]] network of websites, offering services including communication tools, [[online communities]], [[web search]], [[e-commerce]], [[web hosting]], [[homepage]] building and [[Internet access]]. It is an independent corporation, sharing no corporate structure with [[Lycos|Lycos, Inc. (USA)]], but Lycos Europe was formed as a joint-venture between [[Bertelsmann]] and [[Telefonica]].<ref>[http://crenk.com/lycos-europe-to-close-its-doors-is-this-first-step-to-tech-company-closures/ Lycos Europe To Close Its Doors. Is This First Step to Tech Company Closures?] Crenk.com 27 November 2008</ref> On 26 November 2008, Lycos Europe announced that it was to shut down and sell its remaining assets.<ref>[http://www.paidcontent.co.uk/entry/419-lycos-europe-to-shut-down-after-failing-to-find-buyer/ Lycos Europe To Shut Down After Failing To Find Buyer] Robert Andrews. Paid Content UK. 26 November 2008</ref><ref>[http://www.lycos-europe.com/eng/files/2009/LYC_QB3_2009_finale_Version.pdf Interim Report 2009] Lycos Europe N.V</ref>
'''Lycos Europe''' is a [[pan-European]] network of websites, offering services including communication tools, [[online communities]], [[web search]], [[e-commerce]], [[web hosting]], [[homepage]] building and [[Internet access]]. It is an independent corporation, sharing no corporate structure with [[Lycos|Lycos, Inc. (USA)]], but Lycos Europe was formed as a joint-venture between [[Bertelsmann]] and [[Telefonica]].<ref>[http://crenk.com/lycos-europe-to-close-its-doors-is-this-first-step-to-tech-company-closures/ Lycos Europe To Close Its Doors. Is This First Step to Tech Company Closures?] Crenk.com 27 November 2008</ref> On 26 November 2008, Lycos Europe announced that it was to shut down and sell its remaining assets.<ref>[http://www.paidcontent.co.uk/entry/419-lycos-europe-to-shut-down-after-failing-to-find-buyer/ Lycos Europe To Shut Down After Failing To Find Buyer] Robert Andrews. Paid Content UK. 26 November 2008</ref><ref>[http://www.lycos-europe.com/eng/files/2009/LYC_QB3_2009_finale_Version.pdf Interim Report 2009] Lycos Europe N.V</ref>
â
==Controversy==
+
==Make Love Not Spam==
[[Image:MLNS Logo.png|thumb|right|Official Logo]]
[[Image:MLNS Logo.png|thumb|right|Official Logo]]
In [[November 2004]], Lycos Europe introduced a [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Mac OS]] [[screensaver]] program called ''Make Love Not Spam''. It was introduced as both marketing for the then-new Lycos email service Spray Mail, and as a way for users to fight [[Spam (electronic)|spam]] in a collective manner.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/4051553.stm Screensaver tackles spam websites] [[BBC News Online]]. 29 November 2004</ref>
In [[November 2004]], Lycos Europe introduced a [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Mac OS]] [[screensaver]] program called ''Make Love Not Spam''. It was introduced as both marketing for the then-new Lycos email service Spray Mail, and as a way for users to fight [[Spam (electronic)|spam]] in a collective manner.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/4051553.stm Screensaver tackles spam websites] [[BBC News Online]]. 29 November 2004</ref>
